intro: Gamochaeta longipedicellata, commonly known as the long pedicel gamochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in the summer months. Gamochaeta longipedicellata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
